parameters.name: CompName
parameters.description: Path name of a pre-loaded part or assembly to add as a component (see Remarks )

parameters.name: ConfigOption
parameters.description: Mode in which to open the document as specified in swAddComponentConfigOptions_e

parameters.name: NewConfigName
parameters.description: Name for the new assembly configuration; valid only if ConfigOption = swAddComponentConfigOptions_e.swAddComponentConfigOptions_NewConfigWithAllReferenceModels - or - swAddComponentConfigOptions_e.swAddComponentConfigOptions_NewConfigWithAsmStructure

parameters.name: UseConfigForPartReferences
parameters.description: If true, the configuration specified in ExistingConfigName is used

parameters.name: ExistingConfigName
parameters.description: Name of the configuration of the loaded component ; valid only if UseConfigForPartReferences = true

parameters.name: X
parameters.description: X coordinate of the component center

parameters.name: Y
parameters.description: Y coordinate of the component center

parameters.name: Z
parameters.description: Z coordinate of the component center

title: IAssemblyDoc.AddComponent5
description: Adds the specified component for the specified configuration options to this assembly.
signature:
Component2 AddComponent5( 
   System.String
CompName
,
   System.Int32
ConfigOption
,
   System.String
NewConfigName
,
   System.Boolean
UseConfigForPartReferences
,
   System.String
ExistingConfigName
,
   System.Double
X
,
   System.Double
Y
,
   System.Double
Z
)

parameters.name: CompName
parameters.description: Path name of a pre-loaded part or assembly to add as a component (see Remarks )

parameters.name: ConfigOption
parameters.description: Mode in which to open the document as specified in swAddComponentConfigOptions_e

parameters.name: NewConfigName
parameters.description: Name for the new assembly configuration; valid only if ConfigOption = swAddComponentConfigOptions_e.swAddComponentConfigOptions_NewConfigWithAllReferenceModels - or - swAddComponentConfigOptions_e.swAddComponentConfigOptions_NewConfigWithAsmStructure

parameters.name: UseConfigForPartReferences
parameters.description: If true, the configuration specified in ExistingConfigName is used

parameters.name: ExistingConfigName
parameters.description: Name of the configuration of the loaded component ; valid only if UseConfigForPartReferences = true

parameters.name: X
parameters.description: X coordinate of the component center

parameters.name: Y
parameters.description: Y coordinate of the component center

parameters.name: Z
parameters.description: Z coordinate of the component center

remarks:
The specified file must be loaded in memory. A file is loaded into memory when you load the file in your SOLIDWORKS Design session (
ISldWorks::OpenDoc6
) or open an assembly that already contains the file.
To add a new instance of an existing virtual component, use
IComponent2::GetPathName
to get the virtual component's path and file name.
If you want to add the component at a position relative to the root component, use
IComponent2::Transform2
to reposition the component immediately after calling this method. Or, you can use
IAssemblyDoc::AddComponents
or
IAssemblyDoc::AddComponents2
to specify the transform when inserting a component, insert as many components as you want at once, and rotate and scale the component through the transform matrix.
IMPORTANT:
X, Y, and Z are relative to the bounding box of the component. Use this method to approximately position the component. Then use IComponent2::Transform2 to more precisely position the component.
